timeline.message:
- Fixes issue where VALUE order by queries fail parsing the order by elements
- Fixes the result format of SELECT VALUE queries including aggregate queries
  something like {"_value": "2.6"} would now be {2.6} which corresponds to wire data.
- This also enables better support for extracting the results into non key value types like Integer, Double etc.

timeline.bodyText: Isn't klass user type? in which scenario this can be klass == Document.class?
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: This is in the implementation. It will always be Document.class actually. User type is not passed into implementation, conversion only happens just before returning results to user
replies.author: mbhaskar

timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText:
I actually added the reason a bit above than this assert as to why I have to lower the checks. // Weakening validation in this PR as distinctMap has to be changed to accept types not extending from  Resource. This will be enabled in a different PR which is already actively in wip.
I will discuss in more detail offline.
replies.author: mbhaskar

timeline.bodyText: This changes ObjectMapper universally, this is kind of change of behviour however as v4 is not GA yet not a breaking change. I think it should be fine.
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: Yeah, its a universal change. If any concerns, I can create a new ObjectMapper, but this should be Ok IMHO.
replies.author: mbhaskar

replies.bodyText:
Is this applicable for forward write paths as well?
I.e. can the write paths result in un-expected conversion of data?
replies.author: kirankumarkolli
